title: 107_hr3920
content: The "Rancher Preservation Act" may require special provisions for the black-tailed prairie dog under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. The Secretary must use the best scientific and commercial data available to determine the status of the black-tailed prairie dog as an endangered or threatened species. This includes giving weight to empirical or peer-reviewed data and field observations of the species. Data from landowners regarding the species' status must be accepted and acknowledged. The Secretary must consider scientific data, including field observations, to determine the status of the black-tailed prairie dog. Landowners' data on the species must be accepted and included in the rulemaking record for any endangered or threatened species determination. Independent scientific review requirements define actions related to the species' status. The term 'qualified individual' refers to someone with expertise in biological sciences, demonstrated through scientific literature or other means, relevant to the Secretary's decision on the black-tailed prairie dog's status under section 4(a) or (f), without conflicts of interest. The Secretary appoints 3 qualified individuals from a list developed by the National Academy of Sciences for independent scientific review of actions. Before any final action, the Secretary appoints 3 independent scientific reviewers to report on the scientific information. Reviewers are compensated for their work and must provide their opinion within 3 months. The Secretary will consider the reviewers' recommendations before making a final determination. The Secretary appoints 3 independent scientific reviewers to provide recommendations on the black-tailed prairie dog population models. The reviewers' report will be included in the official record for public review before final action is taken. The table of sections in the Act is amended by removing section 13 and adding a new item. The table of sections in the Act is amended by removing section 13 and adding a new item regarding black-tailed prairie dog.
